OVERVIEW: The Anty series consists of very deep, well drained soils that formed in lake sediments. The Anty soils are on lake terraces. Slope ranges from 1 to 10 percent. The mean annual temperature is 48 degrees F, and the mean annual precipitation is about 17 inches.

TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS:  Coarse-loamy, mixed, active, mesic Typic Calcixerolls

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Anty fine sandy loam--cultivated. (Colors are for dry soil unless otherwise noted.)
Ap--0 to 5 inches; grayish brown (10YR 5/2) fine sandy loam, very dark grayish brown (10YR 3/2) moist; weak medium granular structure; soft, friable, nonsticky, nonplastic; few very fine roots; common very fine pores; moderately calcareous; slightly alkaline (pH 7.6); clear smooth boundary. (5 to 8 inches thick)
A--5 to 10 inches; dark grayish brown (10YR 4/2) light fine sandy loam, dark brown (10YR 3/3) moist; weak coarse subangular blocky structure; slightly hard, friable, nonsticky, nonplastic; few very fine roots; common very fine pores; moderately calcareous; slightly alkaline (pH 7.8); clear smooth boundary. (2 to 8 inches thick)
Bw--10 to 15 inches; pale brown (10YR 6/3) fine sandy loam, brown (10YR 4/3) moist; moderate medium subangular blocky structure; hard, friable, slightly sticky, nonplastic; few very fine roots; common very fine pores; moderately calcareous; moderately alkaline (pH 8.0); gradual wavy boundary. (5 to 8 inches thick)
Bk1--15 to 19 inches; light gray (10YR 7/2) fine sandy loam, brown (10YR 5/3) moist; moderate medium subangular blocky structure; hard, friable, slightly sticky, nonplastic; few very fine roots; few very fine pores; few krotovinas, 10 to 15 mm in diameter, brown (10YR 4/3) moist; strongly calcareous; strongly alkaline (pH 8.6); gradual irregular boundary. (0 to 6 inches thick)
Bk2--19 to 26 inches; very pale brown (10YR 8/2) fine sandy loam, light brownish gray (2.5Y 6/2) moist; weak medium subangular blocky structure; hard, friable, slightly sticky, nonplastic; few very fine pores; few krotovinas, 10 to 15 mm. in diameter, brown (10YR 4/3) moist; strongly calcareous; strongly alkaline (pH 8.8); gradual irregular boundary. (6 to 10 inches thick)
Bk3--26 to 35 inches; very pale brown (10YR 8/2) sandy loam, light brownish gray (2.5Y 6/2) moist; massive; slightly hard, friable, nonsticky, nonplastic; few very fine discontinuous pores; few krotovinas, 10 to 15 mm. in diameter, brown (10YR 4/3) moist; strongly calcareous; strongly alkaline (pH 8.8); gradual wavy boundary. (6 to 12 inches thick)
C--35 to 62 inches; very pale brown (10YR 8/2) loamy fine sand, pale brown (10YR 6/3) moist; few medium faint dark yellowish brown (10YR 4/4) mottles, below 48 inches; massive; loose, friable, nonsticky, nonplastic; few very fine discontinuous pores; strongly calcareous; strongly alkaline (pH 8.8).

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  Box Elder County, Utah; about 1 mile west of Plymouth, at a point 1,200 feet north and 700 feet west from the SW corner of sec. 3, T.13N., R.3W.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS: The mean annual soil temperature at 20 inch depth is about 47 degrees to 52 degrees F. and the mean summer temperature is about 68 degrees to 71 degrees F. The soils are usually moist during the period the soil temperature is above 41 degrees F., but are dry for 60 to 90 consecutive days during the summer months when not irrigated. They are moist for 60 to 90 continuous days during the winter.
The mollic epipedon is 7 to 16 inches thick.  Combined thickness of the A and Bw horizons is 12 to 24 inches. Depth to the Bk (calcic) horizon is 12 to 28 inches. Individual layers of the control section range from fine sandy loam to very fine sandy loam or to loamy fine sand, but the control section averages sandy loam or fine sandy loam with less than 18 percent clay.
The A horizon has value of 4 or 5 dry, and chroma of 2 or 3. It is mildly to moderately alkaline and slightly to moderately calcareous. It is 7 to 16 inches thick.
The Bw horizon has value of 5 or 6 dry, and chroma of 2 or 3. It is very fine sandy loam to sandy loam. It is slightly to moderately alkaline and slightly to moderately calcareous.
The Bk horizon has hue of 10YR or 2.5Y, value of 7 or 8 dry, 5 or 6 moist and chroma of 2 through 4. It is fine sandy loam to loamy sand. It is moderately to strongly alkaline.
The C horizon is about the same as the Bk horizon except that it is mainly loamy fine sand to loamy coarse sand below about 35 inches.

COMPETING SERIES.content: COMPETING SERIES:  These are the Blackett, Blue Star, Eccles, Fielding. Kidman, Layton, Martini, Palisade, and Welby series. Blackett, Blue Star, Eccles and Palisade soils are usually dry in all parts of the moisture control section when the soil temperature is above 41 degrees F. Blue Star, and Layton soils are noncalcareous to depths of more than 7 inches. Fielding and Welby soils have less than 15 percent coarser than very fine sand; also Fielding soils have more than 18 percent clay. Kidman soils are noncalcareous to depths of 20 inches or more. Martini and Layton soils lack calcic horizons and Layton soils have loamy fine sand control section. Palisade and Eccles soils have ochric epipedons.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:  Anty soils occur on nearly level to strongly sloping intermediate and high lake terraces at elevations of 4,400 to 5,000 feet. Parent materials are mixed lake sediments and alluvium dominantly from quartzite, limestone and sandstone. The climate is moist subhumid with moist, cold winters and hot, dry summers. The average annual precipitation is 16 to 18 inches. The mean annual temperature is 47 degrees to 51 degrees F. The frost-free period ranges from 120 to 140 days.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:  These are the Timpanogos and Kearns soils and the competing Kidman soils. Timpanogos and Kearns soils are noncalcareous to more than 7 inches and have more than 18 percent clay in the control section.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:  Well-drained; medium runoff; moderately rapid to moderate permeability.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION:  Used for non-irrigated cropland.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  Northern Utah. These soils are not extensive.  MLRA 28A.

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE: Phoenix, Arizona.

ORIGIN.content:
SERIES ESTABLISHED:  Box Elder County (East Box Elder Area) Utah, 1969.
The active cation exchange activity class was added to the taxonomic classification in December 2002 based on soil property data.  The remainder of this document has not been completely updated.
